column4: ok I have the drives mounted but can't access them cause it mounted them as root...how do I access them as me?
add the user option when mounting
did you add it to fstab
where did you mount them to?
use pastebin and put a copy of your fstab
add them to fstab, and remember the user option
if I go to places and then computer....it shows them...but says can't mount them...but if I do df -h it don't even show the drives/partitions so don't know what to put them as..hdd1 or what
the line for your fstab for the windows, assuming hda1 is windows is
you don't understand...I can't seem to find what the drive is labeled as...hdd1 or hda1 or what
my drive is fat32 not ntfs
so change the ntfs part to vfat
ok if my one partition is ext3 would I use the same user info?
ok if my one partition is ext3 would I use the same user info?
did you run a gui program w/ sudo and not gksudo?
sounds like you could have a bad disc or bad hardware, or just generally something went wrong in the install
be sure to run a cd media check
